Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos

vegetarian
mexican

Ingredients

Filling

  • 2 small sweet potatoes
  • 2-4 cloves garlic (to taste)
  • 15 oz can black beans (drained)
  • 1 tbsp taco seasoning

Fixings

  • Tortillas
  • Avocado
  • Sour Cream
  • Pickled red onion
  • Cheese (monterey jack or medium cheddar)

Procedure

  1. Preheat oven to 375
  2. Dice the sweet potatoes into half-inch-ish cubes
  3. Toss sweet potatoes with half the taco seasoning, kosher salt to taste, and a good glug or two of olive oil
  4. Bake sweet potatoes in an oven safe skillet until browned but not soft all the way through (should still be some resistance when pierced with a fork)
  5. Bring skillet to stove top over medium heat and add the garlic, saute until aromatic (about 30 seconds)
  6. Add the drained black beans and the remaining taco seasoning
  7. Heat until beans are warmed through (5-ish minutes)
  8. Warm tortillas and serve.
  9. Top with any desired fixings.
